summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's daily lieutenant's log for August 4, 2019, detailing routine prison operations across three shifts. It records inmate counts, equipment checks, and staff duties. The log is significant as it documents the facility's operations on the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: S. Jean
persons.context: Assumed duties as the Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant at 4:00 PM, conducting standard prison operations and counts.

persons.name: D. Medina
persons.context: Continued duties as the Morning Watch Lieutenant at 12:00 AM, taking over from the Evening Watch shift.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations Log
events.description: Routine prison operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, and staff shift changes.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log documents prison operations for Sunday, August 4, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Inmate counts remained consistent at 762 total inmates and 77 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) throughout all three shifts.
The fire alarm and pump system was reported as inoperable during the Day Watch shift, requiring a fire watch.
The Public Address System was malfunctioning, preventing PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements during the Day and Evening Watch shifts.
No inmates were placed in Administrative Detention, and no WITSEC (Witness Security) inquiries were received during any shift.
